title: What Therapists Don't Talk About And Why: Understanding Taboos That Hurt Us And Our Clients
description: This book is a must-read for any psychotherapist. It explores the realworldand often secret problems encountered in clinical practice in a creative, personal, and very useful fashion. In this world of increasing professionalaccountability and liability, clinicians can be assured that their practices will be much better off for having implemented the commonsense suggestions made by the authors.
author: Kenneth S. Pope
